sen.j: 忍壁 皇子（おさかべ の みこ、生年不詳 - 慶雲2年5月8日 (旧暦)（705年6月2日））は飛鳥時代の皇族である。
sen.e: Prince Osakabe (the date of birth unknown - June 2, 705) was a member of Japanese Imperial family from Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 他のファイルの記載方法に合わせ、'Prince Osakabe'で統一しています。
sen.e: Prince Osakabe (year of birth unknown - June 2, 705) was a member of the Japanese Imperial Family from Asuka period.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。the date→year,Imperial family→Imperial Family と修正しました。
sen.e: Prince Osakabe (year of birth unknown - June 2, 705) was a member of the Japanese Imperial Family from Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天武天皇皇子で母は宍戸臣大麻呂（ししひとのおみおおまろ）の娘。
sen.e: He was the son of Emperor Tenmu and his mother was the daughter of Shishihito no Omimaro.
He was the prince of the Emperor Tenmu and his mother was the daughter of Shishihito no Omiomaro.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。 son→prince,Omimaro→Omiomaro と修正しました。
sen.e: He was the prince of the Emperor Tenmu and his mother was the daughter of Shishihito no Omiomaro.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同母の兄弟姉妹に磯城皇子（しきのみこ）、泊瀬部皇女、託基皇女。
sen.e: His brother and sister-uterine were Prince Shiki, Princess Hatsusebe and Princess Taki.
sen.cmt: 「泊瀬部皇女」の読みは「はつせべのひめみこ」、「託基皇女」は「たきのひめみこ」としました。
sen.e: His siblings were the Prince Shiki, the Princess Hatsusebe and the Princess Taki.
sen.cmt: brother and sister-uterine→siblings と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: His siblings were the Prince Shiki, the Princess Hatsusebe and the Princess Taki.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 忍坂部皇子、刑部親王とも。
sen.e: His name is written in three ways in Japanese Kanji characters; "忍壁皇子," "忍坂部皇子" or "刑部親王."
sen.cmt: 記載の違いを明記するために漢字を追記しました。
sen.e: His name is written in three ways in Japanese Kanji characters; 忍壁皇子, 忍坂部皇子 or 刑部親王.
sen.cmt: クォーツを削除しました。
sen.e: His name is written in three ways in Japanese Kanji characters; 忍壁皇子, 忍坂部皇子 or 刑部親王.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 官位は三品知太政官事。
sen.e: His official rank was Sanbon (the third rank of the Imperial Princes' rank) Chidaijoukanji (Deputy Prime Minister).
sen.cmt: ｢三品」の訳は用語集から取得しました。
sen.e: His official court rank was Sanbon (the third rank of the Imperial Princes' rank) Chidaijoukanji (Deputy Prime Minister).
sen.cmt: official rank→official court rank と修正しました。
sen.e: His official court rank was Sanbon (the third rank of the Imperial Princes' rank) Chidaijoukanji (Deputy Prime Minister).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 明日香皇女を妃としたとされ、山前王（やまさきのみこ）・従三位尚膳小長谷女王の父。
sen.e: He married to Princess Asuka and became the father of Yamakuma no Okimi and Jusanmi Kashiwade no kami (Junior Third Rank, a director of Kashiwade no Tsukasa [Table Office]) Ohase no Joo.
sen.cmt: 原文には「山前王（やまさきのみこ）」とありますが、用語集に合わせ' Yamakuma no Okimi'としています。「従三位尚膳小長谷女王」の読みは「じゅさんみ かしわでのかみ おはせのじょおう」としています。また、尚膳は「膳司の長官」と英語で補足しています。「膳司」の英訳は用語集から取得しました。「小長谷女王」は定訳で'Ohase no Joo (Princess Ohase)'となっていますが、山前王の定訳表記と合わせるため、カッコ部分は省略しています。
sen.e: He was married to the Princess Asuka and became the father of Yamasaki no Miko and Jusanmi Kashiwade no kami (Junior Third Rank, a director of Kashiwade no Tsukasa [Table Office]) Ohase no Joo.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。married to→was married to と修正しました。Yamakuma no Okimi→Yamasaki no Miko (原文に忠実であるということと、「山前」は”やまさき”の読みで確認しました）
sen.e: He was married to the Princess Asuka and became the father of Yamasaki no Miko and Jusanmi Kashiwade no kami (Junior Third Rank, a director of Kashiwade no Tsukasa [Table Office]) Ohase no Joo.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 生年は明かではないが『続日本紀』では第九皇子とある。
sen.e: His date of birth is unknown but "Shoku Nihongi"(Chronicle of Japan Continued) reads that he was the ninth Prince.
His year of birth is unknown but "Shoku Nihongi"(Chronicle of Japan Continued) mentions that he was the ninth prince.
sen.cmt: date→year,reads→mentions,Prince→prince と修正しました。
sen.e: His year of birth is unknown but "Shoku Nihongi"(Chronicle of Japan Continued) mentions that he was the ninth prince.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 尤もこれには異説もあり第四皇子ではないかともいう。
sen.e: However, there is a different opinion that he might be the forth Prince.
However, there is a different opinion that he might be the forth Prince.
sen.cmt: Prince→prince と修正しました。
sen.e: However, there is a different opinion that he might be the forth Prince.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天武天皇元年（672年）の壬申の乱で父天武天皇に従い吉野から東国に赴く。
sen.e: In 672, Prince Osakabe went to Yoshino with his father, Emperor Tenmu during Jinshin War and went to Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region) from there.
sen.cmt: 「東国」の訳は用語集を参照しました。
sen.e: In 672 at the Jinshin war, the Prince Osakabe went to Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region) from Yoshino following his father, the Emperor Tenmu.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。during→at,with→following と修正しました。オーダーを修正しました。
sen.e: In 672 at the Jinshin war, the Prince Osakabe went to Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region) from Yoshino following his father, the Emperor Tenmu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天武天皇3年（674年）石上神宮に派遣され、膏油で神宝の武器を磨かせる。
sen.e: In 674, he was dispatched to Isonokami-jingu Shrine and had special weapons, shinpo (sacred treasure), polished with lamp oil.
sen.cmt: 「膏油」は灯火用の油と解釈し、'lamp oil'としています。
sen.e: In 674, he was dispatched to Isonokami-jingu Shrine, and made the weapons of shinpo (sacred treasure) polished with koyu oil (viscous oil).
sen.cmt: 「膏油」は”粘性の強い油、研磨用の油”ということで、lamp oil とするのは難があると思われ、ここはkoyu oil (viscous oil) としました。文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: In 674, he was dispatched to Isonokami-jingu Shrine, and made the weapons of shinpo (sacred treasure) polished with koyu oil (viscous oil).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天武天皇8年（679年）吉野宮で吉野の盟約に参加し先の壬申の乱の様な戦渦を起こさぬ様誓約した。
sen.e: In 679 at Yoshino no miya, he joined Oath in Yoshino vowing never to cause such calamitous war, Jinshin War, to happen.
sen.cmt: 「吉野の盟約」の訳は用語集を参照しました。
sen.e: In 679 at Yoshino no miya, he joined the Oath in Yoshino vowing never to cause such calamitous war, the Jinshin War, to happen.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。
sen.e: In 679 at Yoshino no miya, he joined the Oath in Yoshino vowing never to cause such calamitous war, the Jinshin War, to happen.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天武天皇10年（681年）3月17日に川島皇子、三野王、忌部子人、中臣大島らと共に「帝紀および上古の諸事」の記録認定事業を命ぜられる。
sen.e: On March 17, 681, Prince Osakabe, together with Prince Kawashima, Minu no Okimi, INBE no Kobito and NAKATOMI no Oshima were assigned for the archiving and accreditation task of 'Teiki oyobi Joko no Shoji' (A genealogy of the Imperial family and matters of high antiquity).
sen.cmt: 「忌部子人」の訳は用語集を参照しました。「帝紀および上古の諸事」は定訳不明のため、日本語を基に補足説明しました。
sen.e: On April 13, 681, the Prince Osakabe, together with the Prince Kawashima, Minu no Okimi, INBE no Kobito and NAKATOMI no Oshima were assigned for the task of recording and authorizing the 'Teiki oyobi Joko no Shoji' (the genealogy of the Imperial family and matters of the high antiquity).
sen.cmt: the を補いました。 天武天皇10年（681年）3月17日→April 13, 681 （グレゴリオ暦に変換）、archiving and accreditation task of→task of recording and authorizing the,A→the,Imperial family→Imperial Family と修正しました。
sen.e: On April 13, 681, the Prince Osakabe, together with the Prince Kawashima, Minu no Okimi, INBE no Kobito and NAKATOMI no Oshima were assigned for the task of recording and authorizing the 'Teiki oyobi Joko no Shoji' (the genealogy of the Imperial family and matters of the high antiquity).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天武天皇14年（685年）冠位を改訂し冠位四十八階に基づき浄大参を賜う。
sen.e: In 685, Prince Osakabe received Jodai Samu no Kurai according to the revised ranking code, Kan I Shijuhakkai (forty-eight grades of cap rank). In the code, Jodai Samu no Kurai was stated as the ninth rank in twelve ranks prepared for Shoo (princes who didn't receive any proclamation to be an Imperial Prince), which was to be distinguished from Shoshin (vassals, retainers).
sen.cmt: 「冠位四十八階」の表記は用語集の「冠位十二階」等を参照し、合わせました。「浄大参」は「浄大参位」と解釈し、用語集から訳を取得しました。また、原文に追加して、「浄大参とは、諸臣とは別に諸王のために用意された12の位の中で、9番目の位である。」と英語で補足説明しています。
sen.e: In 685, the Prince Osakabe received the rank of Jodaisan (Greater Third Pure), according to the revised ranking code, Kan I Shijuhakkai (48 grades of cap rank).
sen.cmt: the, カンマを補いました。 forty-eight→48 と修正しました。「浄大参」については、用語集が定訳不明とあったため"A waka anthology: The gem-glistening cup By Edwin A. Cranston"を参照しました。
sen.e: In 685, the Prince Osakabe received the rank of Jodaisan (Greater Third Pure), according to the revised ranking code, Kan I Shijuhakkai (48 grades of cap rank).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 朱鳥元年（686年）封戸100戸を加封された。
sen.e: His fuko (salary) was raised by 100-households in 686. Fuko were residential units (ko) assigned as prebends (fu) to support top-ranking officials, temples, shrines, and Imperial households.
sen.cmt: 「封戸」の補足説明は用語集を参照しました。
sen.e: His fuko (a vassal household allotted to courtier, shrines and temples) was raised by 100-households in 686.
sen.cmt: よりスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: His fuko (a vassal household allotted to courtier, shrines and temples) was raised by 100-households in 686.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: この年の7月飛鳥浄御原宮の一部が延焼したがこれは忍壁皇子の宮殿が失火したからとも言われている。
sen.e: In July of that year, Asuka Kiyomigahara no miya partially caught fire, which presumably caused by the accidental fire started from the palace of Prince Osakabe.
sen.cmt: 「飛鳥浄御原宮」は他の宮と表記を統一するため'Asuka Kiyomigahara no miya'としています。
sen.e: In July of that year, Asuka Kiyomigahara no miya partially caught a fire, which presumably caused by the accidental fire started from the palace of the Prince Osakabe.
sen.cmt: caught fire→caught a fire と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: In July of that year, Asuka Kiyomigahara no miya partially caught a fire, which presumably caused by the accidental fire started from the palace of the Prince Osakabe.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 持統天皇10年（696年）高市皇子薨去に伴い天武天皇諸皇子中最年長となり皇族の代表的存在となる。
sen.e: As the First Prince Takechi passed away in 696, Prince Osakabe became the oldest prince among the living sons of Emperor Tenmu and became a representative person in the Imperial family.
sen.cmt: 高市皇子と忍壁皇子の関係を明確にするため、英訳では高市皇子を'the First Prince Takechi' としています。
sen.e: As the Prince Takechi passed away in 696, the Prince Osakabe became the oldest prince among the princes of the Emperor Tenmu, and became a representative figure in the Imperial Family.
sen.cmt: First を削除しました。the, カンマを補いました。living sons→princes,person→figure,Imperial family→Imperial Family と修正しました。
sen.e: As the Prince Takechi passed away in 696, the Prince Osakabe became the oldest prince among the princes of the Emperor Tenmu, and became a representative figure in the Imperial Family.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 持統朝においては彼の事績は伝わらないが、黒岩重吾は持統天皇に嫌われ、不遇をかこっていた所を藤原不比等の入知恵で甥の文武天皇擁立を支持し、漸く政界復帰したものと主張している。
sen.e: There is no precise historical records about the achievement of Prince Osakabe during the reign of Empress Jito, but a novelist Jugo KUROIWA argues that Fujiwara no Fuhito suggest the prince, who at that time were lamenting over his misfortune since the empress disliked him, that he should support an idea to enthrone Emperor Monmu, the nephew of Prince Osakabe, and he finally could return to political world.
sen.cmt: 黒岩重五氏の補足説明として英訳では' a novelist'を追記しています。
sen.e: There is no precise historical records about the achievement of the Prince Osakabe during the reign of the Empress Jito, but Jugo KUROIWA argues that Fujiwara no Fuhito suggest the prince, who was lamenting over his misfortune since the empress disliked him, to support the enthronement of the Emperor Monmu, the nephew of the Prince Osakabe, then he finally could return to political world.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。文脈に応じてスムースに修正しました。補足説明を削除しました。（仕様説明書、”「新たな情報の追加」を避け、原文にある情報のみにとどめる”に従い）
sen.e: There is no precise historical records about the achievement of the Prince Osakabe during the reign of the Empress Jito, but Jugo KUROIWA argues that Fujiwara no Fuhito suggest the prince, who was lamenting over his misfortune since the empress disliked him, to support the enthronement of the Emperor Monmu, the nephew of the Prince Osakabe, then he finally could return to political world.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その後、文武天皇3年（700年）6月大宝律令選定を指揮し、翌年完成。
sen.e: Later in June 700, Prince Osakabe superintended the selecting and compiling project of Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code), which was completed next year.
Later, in July 699, the Prince Osakabe conducted the selecting and compiling the Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code), which was completed the following year.
sen.cmt: 「文武天皇3年（700年）6月」を検索ツールで変換すると西暦699年7月6日となります(グレゴリオ暦）。the, カンマを補いました。superintended→conducted,next year→following year と修正しました。project of を削除しました。
sen.e: Later, in July 699, the Prince Osakabe conducted the selecting and compiling the Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code), which was completed the following year.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 大宝 (日本)3年（703年）に太政大臣に就任する。
sen.e: He was appointed to Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state) in 703.
sen.cmt: 「太政大臣」の訳は用語集を参照しました。
sen.e: He was appointed to Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state) in 703.

sen.e: He was appointed to Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state) in 703.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 慶雲2年（705年）5月薨去。
sen.e: He passed away in June 705.
sen.cmt: 5月薨去とありますが、旧暦と解釈し、英訳では6月にしています。
sen.e: He passed away in May 705.
sen.cmt: 「慶雲2年（705年）5月」は検索ツールで変換すると西暦705年5月31日となるため、5月に修正しました。
sen.e: He passed away in May 705.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 忍壁皇子を高松塚古墳の被葬者とする説がある。

There is a theory that Takamatsuzuka Tomb was built for the Prince Osakabe.
